subject: Re: [junit] Global variable?
msgSnippet: I could be wrong. There is a UI that you can select reload... . Part of the JUnit GUI runner I think, in which case each TestCase get s it s own classloader
messageBody:
I could be wrong. There is a UI that you can select
"reload...". Part of the JUnit GUI runner I think, in
which case each TestCase get's it's own classloader
instance each time it runs. I thought I read each run
get's its own loader instance anyway to "sandbox" it
so that across runs one testcase run can not affect
another testcase run. However, again, I may be wrong
on this.

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Kevin Duffey wrote:
>
> > JUnit loads each TestCase in it's own classloader.
>
> Unless something has changed while I wasn't looking,
> that is not true at
> all.
>
> Each test executes as a separate instance of
> TestCase, which explains
> why writing to an instance variable from one test
> will not affect the
> value read by another test. This is why data shared
> between tests needs
> to be class-level, or global.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
